prompt.text: Which of the following best characterizes the military structure of Pakistan?

feedback.text: Pakistan’s military has clear chains of command. Decisions require several layers of approval, and lower officers will generally not have authority.

translation.text: Top heavy and formal, where only high ranking officers make decisions.

feedback.text: Actually, Pakistan’s military has clear chains of command. Decisions require several layers of approval, and lower officers will generally not have authority.

translation.text: Decentralized, where lower ranking officers can make decisions.

feedback.text: Actually, Pakistan’s military is highly structured with clear chains of command. Decisions require several layers of approval.

translation.text: Disorganized, with very little structure at all.

feedback.text: Actually, Pakistan’s military is highly structured with clear chains of command. They are often thought of as a highly professional military.

translation.text: Inexperienced, and in need of American support.
